boat.construction_details: Carvel, pitch pine, teak and iroko on oak and iroko.
boat.full_description:
'Valerie' is reputed to have run guns for the IRA about the same time as Erskine Childers with Asgard although proof of this would be hard to find. She took part in the OGA Solent Race, 1972.

Following a full restoration and re-rig undertaken by Waterfront Marine, completed in 2013, she moved south to the Hamble River in 2017.
boat.name: Valerie

ownerships.note: A.J.Ellis listed as an owner - date unknown. A.R.T Kirby advertising her for sale in 1966 OGA newsletter.
ownerships.text: A.J.Ellis listed as an owner - date unknown. A.R.T Kirby advertising her for sale in

boat.short_description: 'Valerie' was built by Harry Stow to his own design. Originally a yawl she was altered to a cutter in 1939 and around 1970 to a 2 masted schooner before returning to a yawl in 2013.
